intro: Sida velloziana, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to the Americas and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is known for its hairy, velvety texture, which gives it its common name. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Sida velloziana is an annual or biennial plant that can become invasive in certain regions.
